newsitem.title: GHANA: Ghana bourse creeps up in moderate trade.
newsitem.headline: Ghana bourse creeps up in moderate trade.

text.p: The Ghana Stock Exchange index rose slightly on Tuesday, buoyed by Standard Chartered bank which gained on a report showing a sharp rise in its assets, traders said.

The GSE All-Share index climbed by 0.12 points to 363.11 from 362.99 on Wednesday, the last trading session before the Easter break. Tuesday's session was in lieu of Monday, which was also a public holiday.
The only declining issue was Aluworks, down 100 cedis to 1,200.

Standard Chartered Bank advanced by 100 cedis to 5,200. Results of banks published last week showed Standard Chartered as Ghana's fastest growing commercial bank, with total assets soaring 53 percent in 1996 from the 1995 level.
Bourse volume was moderate with 34,370 shares changing hands, against 38,390 on Wednesday. Bids outpaced offers by 3,818,170 to 544,070.
Tuesday's transactions are due for settlement on Wednesday before resumption of normal trading (Monday, Wednesday and Friday), a GSE statement said last week.
